content: i made my sweaters from scraps of rowan pure wool superwash worsted leftover from the martin storey afghan kal and the kaffe fassett kal in the model sweater i used a fourth color for the back but the pattern is written for three colors this is meant to be a real scrappy sweater and as long as you make gauge and use a soft machine-washable yarn it s for baby after all you can be thrifty and raid your stash using 3 4 5 or more colors the color possibilities are endless and i can t wait to see what you come up with if you would like a summer sweater i suggest rowan handknit cotton or rowan softknit cotton both will give you gauge and both are machine washable i ve sized gingersnap for one year which is my favorite size to knit for baby hear me out at one year old babies are sitting up walking about smiling and laughing clapping their hands and generally causing a lot of commotion and attention to themselves and thereby giving a lot of attention to your nice sweater you can purchase gingersnap for bigger kids sized from 1 to 8 years with a bonus 6 mos size here https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/gingersnap-for-bigger-kids
